website_summaries.verdict: We wish it cost a little less, but if you've already got Philips Hue LEDs or HomeKit gadgets in your home, then adding the Tap to your setup makes a lot of sense.
pros: The easy-to-use Philips Hue Tap brings practical convenience to existing smart lighting setups
Its wireless, kinetic-powered design needs no battery or electricity, which is beyond cool
cons: The buttons require a little too much oomph in order to trigger your lights
Also, the lack of IFTTT integration seems like a huge missed opportunity

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 2 weeks, now we have to hit it 2 or three times to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gill

customer_reviews.title: Works every time and doesn't need batteries
customer_reviews.text: I love this technology. It never needs batteries and it has worked flawless every time I've used it. Setup with the hue app was really easy. I hope I won't have to replace this for a long time but if I do I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: WildanessDude

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should, easy to set up, but I find that it is sometimes hard to remember what I programmed the buttons for, but not enough of an issue to give it fewer stars. I do find myself using the dimmer button more for two reasons (easier to figure out what is what, and it is magnetized so it can go on my fridge), however this can control more scenarios that the dimmer switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These make light switching easy. U can use them to turn on/off any ...
customer_reviews.text: These make light switching easy. U can use them to turn on/off any lights in the house not just 1 room. So I can turn on my kitchen and my garage light before I even enter the garage, instead of fumbling around looking for the switch in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Islandwrath

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Other than the price, this is pretty much exactly what I wanted for my living room lighting: some switches! Imagine that! I have it set to a few different presets: "house lights" (all on), movie, nighttime, and all off. My wife and I are using this several times a day, every day, and it works perfectly every time. Remember that you have to fully press all the way "through" to get an actuation. Strongly considering getting more for other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Philips hits another home run.
customer_reviews.text: The way of the future. At first it seemed odd not having the switch on the wall. But now I find it the only way I want to go. These are easy to set up and they just work.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Fisher

customer_reviews.title: You should buy!
customer_reviews.text: Makes it so much easier to manage your light settings. You should buy!
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't need batteries (for better or worse)
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. I wish it were a little easier to push the buttons. A small battery and soft buttons (like the dimmer switch) would have been nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Messer

customer_reviews.title: like it's partially broken
customer_reviews.text: It's not very well designed. The whole thing feels squishy, like it's partially broken. You have to press the buttons too far down for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: mattgriffin

customer_reviews.title: The fact that it doesn't use batteries is rather cool.
customer_reviews.text: It just works. Makes it much easier to live with Hue bulbs, and worthwhile if you've made the 'investment' in this novelty. No problems setting it up and it has been trouble free since initially set up.The fact that it doesn't use batteries is rather cool.
customer_reviews.author: dgolds

customer_reviews.title: Button gripe
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes pressing a small button does the action for hitting big button. Otherwise its great!
customer_reviews.author: David Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I really love how easy it is to control my lights from ...
customer_reviews.text: The possibilities this has with certain apps are infinite! I really love how easy it is to control my lights from the day i bought it
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! A little on the pricey side, but it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Eremicus

customer_reviews.title: You know it's true.
customer_reviews.text: Because sometimes you want to turn on your fancy-pants voice-activated home illumination system with a handy wall switch. Plus: Presets!
customer_reviews.author: TinkleToes

customer_reviews.title: but it works great! It has a nice design and being able ...
customer_reviews.text: It appears cheap/platic when you see the device very close, but it works great! It has a nice design and being able to have more control over the philips Hue is amazing. And the best, it really does work withot being attached to any energy source!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Lima

customer_reviews.title: This switch is very temperamental and inconsistent. I find ...
customer_reviews.text: This switch is very temperamental and inconsistent. I find myself having to click the buttons numerous times for them to work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Keetell

customer_reviews.title: Product is nice, but it could be better with simple improvements
customer_reviews.text: Product is nice, but it could be better with simple improvements. It has 4 buttons, where you can add 4 actions. It would be better if you could add turn on action, and turn off action in the same button. For example, I have an action to turn on living room lights at the button 1, and turn it off at button 2. Turn on dinner room lights at button 3, and turn it off at button 4. If I could turn on and off the action at the same button, I could add 4 scenes instead of just 2.
customer_reviews.author: Joao Thomeo Neto

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, and sometimes Hue lights don't respond at all
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable. Setup was easy enough. But I often have to press a button several times to get my lights to respond. Sometimes, the Hues don't respond at all and I have to get my phone and open the app, defeating the entire purpose. The bridge is about four feet away, line-of-sight, no obstructions; it's probably less the hardware, and more the software on the bridge itself.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Hue Tap Switch belongs in the garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the cheapest, crappiest pieces of tech I've had the misfortune to own. The idea is good, the design is attractive, it just DOESN'T WORK. There is a major flaw in that 75% of the time your button presses are registered incorrectly. You're constantly fumbling around with this piece of garbage, turning all the lights in your house off and on, disturbing people in other rooms. I can't believe I spent $90 on this. I thought wall mounting would make things better but it didn't. Stay away from the Hie Tap Switch. Love my bulbs, hate the switch. Wait for an improved version to come out or something.
customer_reviews.author: Jase Howland

customer_reviews.title: this thing is set up and works great! You can set 3 modes or scenes and ...
customer_reviews.text: With the HUE app, this thing is set up and works great! You can set 3 modes or scenes and off to a single unit. Doesn't user batteries which is a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Only buy new.
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these and love them. However, this one (listed as "refurbished) is just flat out broken.
customer_reviews.author: Shandower

customer_reviews.title: The Mother of All Gadgets
customer_reviews.text: The mother of all gadgets. Have thoroughly enjoyed finding new ways to improve my living spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Jellins

customer_reviews.title: My junk gets turned on AND turned off by this ...
customer_reviews.text: My junk gets turned on AND turned off by this one product. No one should be able to wield this much power.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stone

customer_reviews.title: Battery Free, Programmable, But Still Needs Some Functionality
customer_reviews.text: A great wall switch for your Hue system. The battery free operation is really quite cool, even if that means a popping clack every time you push it. This really should be a prototype for future lighting. Put your switches where YOU want them, not where you can cut a hole in the wall. This product however needs some more functionality. The buttons should be able to CYCLE two scenes each, at least. The big button should be a configurable as a toggle for on and off. Also, as a pioneering channel on the IFTTT service, you should be able to use the Tap as a IFTTT trigger. Still, a high 4-star review with room for improvement.
customer_reviews.author: blaincorrous

customer_reviews.title: skip this product
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a couple months, now it no longer works at all. Even before it stopped working, it didn't have a whole lot of functionality for the hassle and cost. When it turned the lights on, for example, it didn't turn them on at the proper light level. It only turned them on 100%. Then I'd have to reach for my smartphone to dim the lights anyway, making the Tap pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Monsieur Tarzan

customer_reviews.title: Purposefully broke itself with update, avoid
customer_reviews.text: I am returning mine. A recent update made everything break, and stop working with the non-Phillips bulbs. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: sadf

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, BUY INSTEAD...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working completely shortly after 30 days. Buy a regular switch and then buy iConnectHue for your phone to reprogram it to do as much as this can do.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Good with other hue products
customer_reviews.text: Bought this off eBay. Only controls hue accessories. Actions are fast and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne Braun

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, this thing is only OK. Philips should ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this thing is only OK. Philips should really build-in a way to manually control Hue lights, instead of making you buy a separate device with mediocre engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Waters

product_meta.title: Philips Hue Tap
product_meta.description: Change the way you control light at home with the Philips Hue Tap Switch. Remotely recall your four favorite Philips Hue light scenes at the press of a button. Select from your own scenes, scenes created by Philips, or program a button to switch all lights on/off. Requiring the Philips Hue Bridge (sold separately) for the full Hue experience, this switch does not need batteries. It uses kinetic energy and is powered by your touch. Mount the Hue Tap anywhere with the included mounting plate, or detach it and carry it with you as you move through your home. Add up to 12 other Hue accessories (sold separately) such as the Hue Dimmer Switch or Hue Motion Sensor. Control by voice with Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant. Connect it with your Nest or Samsung SmartThings system. This box includes a Hue Tap with wall plate and two-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Remotely recall your four favorite Philips Hue light scenes at the press of a button. Select from your own scenes, scenes created by Philips, or program a button to switch all lights on/off.
Requiring the Philips Hue Bridge (sold separately) for the full Hue experience, this switch does not need batteries. It uses kinetic energy and is powered by your touch.
Mount the Hue Tap anywhere with the included mounting plate, or detach it and carry it with you as you move through your home.
Add up to 12 other Hue accessories (sold separately) such as the Hue Dimmer Switch or Hue Motion Sensor. Control by voice with Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant.
Connect it with your Nest or Samsung SmartThings system. This box includes a Hue Tap with wall plate and two-year warranty.

specifications.Special Features: No batteries or AC required. Works in kinetic energy.
